alert.note: Alert for Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 30 at 3:51PM EDT until July 30 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... Quitman County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 350 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lakepoint Resort State Park, or 11 miles north of Georgetown, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cuthbert, Georgetown, Springvale Station, Morris, Peterson Hill, Coles, White House, Crossroads, Benevolence, Springvale, Randolph Co A/p and Wades. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
